summary: The Disaster AID Act aims to improve disaster response by enhancing local capabilities, guaranteeing stable federal funding for impacted communities, and streamlining processes. It focuses on mitigation efforts, public assistance (including advance assistance and simplified procedures), and other provisions related to disaster relief. Key aspects include funding for state hazard mitigation offices, adjustments to the hazard mitigation grant program, and provisions for managing costs and timelines. The bill also includes technical assistance pilot programs, regulation simplification, and reporting requirements related to disaster assistance programs.
